blocks.value: Saint Pio of Pietrelcina, known as Padre Pio, was a Capuchin friar who bore the wounds of Christ (stigmata) for 50 years. He is one of the most beloved modern saints, known for his holiness, spiritual gifts, and pastoral charity.

Padre Pio had numerous mystical experiences: bilocation, the ability to read hearts in confession, miraculous healings, and prophetic knowledge. Thousands traveled to receive his blessing and confess their sins to him.

Despite poor health and spiritual attacks, Padre Pio spent hours daily in prayer, especially before the Blessed Sacrament. His Mass could last two hours as he lived Christ's Passion. He died in 1968 and was canonized in 2002. His motto: 'Pray, hope, and don't worry.'
